Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a voluted nozzle, decorated on the discus with a band of tongues. Within the base-ring is the impressed letter I. Greenish-buff clay covered with a red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1898)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
